caller_intent: MJ is selling their truck and wants to understand how to maintain insurance coverage while transitioning from automatic to manual insurance with Glider, specifically asking if they can switch to a commercial insurance policy on a personal car during this process.
resolution_steps: Jessica clarifies that MJ cannot add a personal auto policy to their existing commercial policy; they must cancel the current policy and obtain a new one once they have the new truck.
She explains that if the new truck takes longer than a couple of weeks to acquire, MJ can keep the existing policy active for up to a month or more if needed.
Jessica acknowledges MJ's concern about losing authority if they cancel the policy and confirms that canceling would result in losing coverage.
knowledge_required: Understanding of commercial vs. personal auto insurance policies
Insurance policy cancellation and renewal processes
Handling coverage gaps during vehicle transitions
summary: MJ is selling their truck and seeks guidance on maintaining insurance coverage while transitioning to a new policy. Jessica explains that they must cancel their current commercial policy and obtain a new one once they acquire the new truck, but can keep the existing policy active temporarily if needed. The call concludes with MJ satisfied after receiving clarification on the process.
